title: Musk seeks up to $134 billion damages from OpenAI, Microsoft
description: Musk left OpenAI’s board in 2018, launched his own artificial intelligence company in 2023 and began legal proceedings in 2024.
content:
Elon Musk wants OpenAI and Microsoft to pay him damages in the range of $79 billion to $134 billion over his claims that the generative AI company defrauded him by abandoning its nonprofit roots and partnering with the software giant.

title: AI adoption outpaces training; 71% professionals expect role changes: Report
description: Artificial Intelligence is rapidly changing workplaces. Many professionals expect their jobs to evolve significantly in the coming years due to AI. However, a large number feel their companies are not providing adequate training on AI tools. This lack of guidance leads to uncertainty about AI's role.

title: ‘Why are Americans paying for AI in India?’ Trump aide Navarro targets US-funded ChatGPT use abroad
description: White House trade adviser Peter Navarro has once again targeted India, questioning why Americans are paying for artificial intelligence services used in the country. Speaking in a media interview, Navarro argued that platforms such as OpenAI’s ChatGPT operate on US soil and rely on American electricity, while serving a large number of users overseas, including in India.

title: Musk seeks up to $134 billion in damages in lawsuit against OpenAI and Microsoft
description: The world’s richest man is pressing a high-stakes legal fight that could reshape the future of artificial intelligence partnerships.

title: After 15,000 layoffs, Microsoft cuts news and library access amid shift to AI learning

content:

title: Google introduces new AI model to convert textbooks into interactive lessons
description: Google has rolled out an experimental artificial intelligence model to reshape how textbooks are used. The tool focusses on personalised, interactive learning formats backed by early research findings. Learners can use the tool to convert textbooks into mind maps, quizzes etc. and stud in the way they like.
